Comments_List: I learned a lot about iterative fitting which was really interesting.
Iterative fitting, web scrapping, python, hypothesis testing, F test and projection
R programming, especially for fitting linear models, for instance iterative fitting procedure, and statistical simulations to estimate for instance hypothesis testing power.
I learned programming skills in Python and R
we could improve by including a larger volume of information.

strengths: a great combination of conceptual knowledge of data analysis. The part of the projection and F test is very impressive.
weakness: the assignments sometimes were a little bit easy and less critical or creative. Hope the instructor could teach more things about how to use Python to conduct data analysis.
I enjoyed the problem sets, which I felt were well designed, unique, and we were given a reasonable amount of time to do them.

The course was not very well structured and it was not clear how the content of the course was organized. The projects were often different from the material we covered in class, so I think it would have been helpful to have more practical class content and just give theoretical content for background.
Yes. The instructor provides lots of interesting and innovative perspective of data analysis.
Yes, the student will have a lot of data analysis programming practice.
I would be hesitant in recommending this course because the course wasn't very well organized so it was hard to follow what was going on.
